definition: to float on the current/to drift along or about/rafting
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Every time another episode of Castaway was aired, it got worse.
sentences.chinese: 每看到一次電視裏播放的漂流者事蹟，情況就會更糟。

sentences.english: May his children be wandering beggars; may they be driven from their ruined homes.
sentences.chinese: 願他的兒女漂流討飯，從他們荒涼之處出來求食。

sentences.english: Whoever you are, we too lie in drifts at your feet.
sentences.chinese: 無論你是誰，我們也在你腳邊的漂流物中躺着。

sentences.english: Rafting can be exciting, but on the other hand, it can be dangerous sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 乘筏漂流令人激動，但另一方面它有時也是危險的。

sentences.english: I is just the sailor in the river, to vagabondize in it by a small boat.
sentences.chinese: 我就是河上的一個水手，架着一條小船在河中漂流。

sentences.english: You can go drifting in Dawei Mountain from June to Octorber.
sentences.chinese: 去大圍山漂流，六到十月都可以。

sentences.english: Finishing lunch, we went to the drifting headwaters.
sentences.chinese: 午餐後，我們去漂流的源頭。

sentences.english: Some icebergs, however, drift north to warmer climates and disintegrate.
sentences.chinese: 不過，也有一些冰山會往北漂流到溫帶然後消融。

sentences.english: We want to be white-water rafting.
The boat of refugees was turned adrift by order of the guard.
sentences.chinese: 衛兵命令把難民船驅逐任其在海上漂流。

sentences.english: The drift wood could have been drifting in the ocean currents for months or even years.
sentences.chinese: 這塊漂木可能已在洋流中漂流了數月或者幾年。

sentences.english: They were cast away on a desert island without food or water.
sentences.chinese: 他們漂流到一個荒島上，既無食物，也沒有水喝。

sentences.english: "Robinson Crusoe" took me into a strange world full of danger.
sentences.chinese: “魯賓遜漂流記”帶我到一個陌生的世界充滿了危險。

sentences.english: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
sentences.chinese: 願他的兒女漂流討飯，從他們荒涼之處出來求食。

sentences.english: Much gold and silver drift dissolved in the waters of the sea, too.
sentences.chinese: 還有不少金和銀的漂流物溶解在海水裏。

sentences.english: The boat was all adrift two days and nights.
sentences.chinese: 這條船漂流了兩天兩夜。

definition: variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
to float away/to drift/to be swept off
